bill_title: to reduce state aid to education to certain school districts with excess general fund cash balances and to prohibit certain transfers.
keywords: Department of Education and Cultural Affairs

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to to reduce state aid to education to certain school districts with excess general fund cash balances and to prohibit certain transfers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created the Excess General Fund Balance Oversight Board. The board shall consist of five members, appointed by the secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs. Section 2. That chapter 13-13 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Unless the Excess General Fund Balance Oversight Board grants a waiver from the provisions of this Act, beginning with the state aid to education distribution for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2002, a school district's entitlement for state aid provided for in this chapter shall be reduced by the amount by which the school district's ending general fund balance plus any general funds transferred to the capital outlay fund in excess of five percent of the previous year's general fund expenditures exceeds: thirty percent of its general fund expenditures or two hundred fifty thousand dollars, whichever is greater, for the school fiscal year prior to the school fiscal year for which state aid to education is to be distributed. Section 3. Any school district anticipating that its ending general fund cash balance will be in excess of the amounts provided for in section 2 of this Act may apply to the Excess General Fund Balance Oversight Board for a waiver from all or part of the reduction in state aid to education provided for in section 2 of this Act. A school district applying for a waiver shall provide the Excess General Fund Balance Oversight Board with a detailed accounting and reasons for anticipating that the school district's ending general fund cash balance will be in excess of the amount provided for in section 2 of this Act. Section 4. The Excess General Fund Balance Oversight Board may grant a waiver for all or part of the reduction in state aid to education provided for in section 2 of this Act. The board may request additional information from a school district and shall arrive at a decision within three weeks after receiving an application from a school district or any additional information requested by the board. Section 5. All decisions of the Excess General Fund Balance Oversight Board shall require a vote of at least three members of the board. Section 6. The Department of Education and Cultural Affairs may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to define general fund balances for the purposes for which the term is used in this Act and criteria for the Excess General Fund Oversight Board to grant waivers.
